1:
I love Yahweh\q2 because he hears me when I cry to him for help.
\q1
2:
He listens to me,\q2 so I will call out to him all during my life.



\q1
3:
Everything around me caused me to think that I would die;\q2 I was very afraid that I would die and go to the place where dead people are.
\q1 I was very distressed and afraid.
\q1
4:
But then I called out to Yahweh, saying,\q2 "Yahweh, I plead with you to save me!"



\q1
5:
Yahweh is kind and does what is right;\q2 he is our God, and he acts mercifully to us.
\q1
6:
He protects those who are helpless;\q2 when I thought that I would die, he saved me.



\q1
7:
I must encourage myself\q2 because Yahweh has done very good things for me.
\q1
8:
Yahweh has saved me from dying\q2 and has kept me from troubles that would cause me to cry.
\q1 He has kept me from disaster.


\q1
9:
So here on the earth where people are still alive,\q2 I live, knowing that Yahweh is directing me.
\q1
10:
I continued to believe in Yahweh,\q2 even when I said, "I am greatly afflicted."
\q1
11:
Even when I was distressed and said, "I cannot trust anyone,"\q2 I continued to trust in Yahweh.



\q1
12:
So now I will tell you what I will offer to Yahweh\q2 because of all the good things that he has done for me.
\q1
13:
I will offer to him a cup of wine\q2 to thank him for saving me.
\q1
14:
When I am together with many people who belong to Yahweh,\q2 I will give to him the offerings that I solemnly promised to give to him.
\q1
15:
Yahweh is very grieved when one of his people dies.

\q1
16:
I am one of those who serves Yahweh;\q2 I serve him like my mother did.
\q2 He has ended my troubles.
\q1
17:
So I will offer to him a sacrifice to thank him,\q1 and I will pray to him.


\q1
18:
18-19 When I am together with many of the people who belong to Yahweh\q2 in the courtyard outside his temple in Jerusalem,
\q2 I will give to him the offerings that I solemnly promised to give to him.
\q1 Praise Yahweh!
